ActFood and Drugs Act
Patent Act
SubjectRegulations Amending Certain Regulations Concerning Drugs and Medical Devices (Shortages)
PrecisRegulations Amending CERTAIN REGULATIONS CONCERNING DRUGS AND MEDICAL DEVICES (SHORTAGES) in order to (1) maintain a number of the powers from the interim orders made to address shortages since March 2020; (2) introduce exceptional importation frameworks for drugs to the Food and Drug Regulations and for medical devices to the Medical Devices Regulations by permitting the importation and sale of products that do not fully meet Canadian regulatory requirements for market authorization but are set out on the List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale or on the List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale; (3) introduce a requirement for manufacturers and importers to report shortages and anticipated shortages of specified medical devices; (4) allow the Minister of Health to place specific devices or types of devices on the List if a shortage presents or may present a risk of injury to human health; (5) prohibit drug establishment licence holders from selling certain drugs intended for the Canadian Market for consumption or use outside of Canada if that sale could cause or exacerbate a shortage in Canada; (6) introduce a provision that allows the Minister of Health to request information from regulated parties that the Minister may require to assess a drug or medical device shortage; (7) extend flexibilities related to drug establishment licences for drug-based hand sanitizers; and 8) amend the definition of "authorization for sale" to exclude a circumstance where an exceptionally imported drug has been permitted for sale under C.10.008(1).
